Welcome to

Employment First Missouri


In 2010, the Massachusetts Department of Development Services (DDS) adopted an Employment First policy. Today, DDS is working to increase the focus on integrated community employment as the preferred outcome for adults with intellectual disabilities.

Featured Resources

DDS Employment First Policy

Explore Prepare Act

Featured Promising Practices

A "promising practice" is an innovative policy, practice, or procedure that promotes integrated community employment for individuals with intellectual disabilities.

This series of promising practices illustrates creative strategies that promote Employment First in Massachusetts. We are sharing them here to spread the word and spark the imagination of service providers, individuals with disabilities, and their families.

Work Inc.: Using Strategic Planning to Support Transformation

Academic and Vocational Opportunities for Transition-Age Youth: New England Business Associates

Making Community Connections for Transition-Age Youth: Melrose Rotary Club, Melrose, MA

Partnering with Schools to Serve Transition-Age Youth: Berkshire County Arc, Pittsfield, MA

Multiple Options for Transition from School to Work: Community Enterprises, Holyoke, MA

Community-Based Instruction for Transition-Age Youth: King Philip Regional High School, Wrentham, MA
